Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2007 04:37PM kiwicaroline wrote: I was having my annual mammogram and ultrasound when it was picked up. as I am still in my thirtys they always followup with an ultrasound because of dense breast tissue in younger women. nothing showed on the mammogram so its a good thing I always have the ultrasound as well. Only 1 tumor showed up on the ultra sound the others were anafter surgery suprise. at least they are all out now. The tumor panel met last night to decide on my treatment plan so I shouldget all the details tomorrow at my oncs appt.
Posts.Title: local recuurence 7 years after initial diagnosis kiwicaroline WendyInCalif

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2007 07:57PM kiwicaroline wrote: Rainenz I am in Auckland but am originally from Hawkes Bay and have been to Palmerston North many times. When My mother had Breast Cancer a few years ago she had a lot of her treatment in Palmerston.
Posts.Title: local recuurence 7 years after initial diagnosis kiwicaroline WendyInCalif

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2007 10:35PM kiwicaroline wrote: So I have seen the onc and at this stage he is only recommending zoladex shots for 2 years as estrogen is my enemy. While I have no desire to do chemo again I cant help wondering if the zoladex is enough. i had so much treatment last time and it still came back. Still I know It was the tamoxifen that kept it at bay for so long so hormonals maybe all i need. What bugs me is that I asked what would happen after The 2 years he said well we will just wait and see how tough you ovaries are before we make any more decisions. Thats a bit vague for my liking.
Posts.Title: local recuurence 7 years after initial diagnosis kiwicaroline WendyInCalif

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2007 07:42PM kiwicaroline wrote: They seem to think it is a recurrence as all the tumors are histologically similiar to my first tumor. I suppose they can never bee 100% sure. in my mind I would prefer it to be a new cancer and not one that was so strong it bet surgery, rads,chemo and tamoxifen to come back ad reproduce 4 times.
